DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown whether there is an existing hypersensitivity, a local or general reaction of an organism following contact with a specific allergen to which it has been previously exposed and to which it has become sensitized, to a therapeutic agent (drug, intervention therapy) used in a clinical trial protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to an existing hypersensitivity, a local or general reaction of an organism following contact with a specific allergen to which it has been previously exposed and to which it has become sensitized, to a therapeutic agent (drug, intervention therapy) used in a clinical trial protocol.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A therapeutic agent (drug, intervention therapy) used in a clinical trial protocol.

Concepts.definition: A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial.

Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Altered reactivity to an antigen, which can result in pathologic reactions upon subsequent exposure to that particular antigen.

Concepts.definition: An immune response that occurs following exposure to an innocuous antigen, but that does not require the presence of preformed antibodies to the antigen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Prior allergic reaction to st
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior allergic reaction to study agent

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior allergic reaction to study agents

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of allergic reactions attributed to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition to OSI-906

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of allergic reactions attributed to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition to MLN8237, including but not limited to established allergic reaction to benzodiazepines?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC Question Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of allergic reactions to any of the study drugs?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of allergic reactions attributed to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition to ibrutinib or lenolidomide?

ReferenceDocuments.name: GI_CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior allergic reactions attributed to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition to Gemcitabine or Cisplatin

ReferenceDocuments.name: eligibiity question
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of allergic reactions attributed to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition to olaparib and cediranib?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC 1603
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of hypersensitivity or allergic reactions to any of the study drugs?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of allergic reactions attributed to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition to cediranib or olaparib?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a known allergy to cisplatin or compounds of similar biologic composition?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF TEXT 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a known history of grade 3-4 allergic reaction and/or hepatic toxicity to cisplatin, carboplatin, or gemcitabine?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of allergic reactions attributed to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition to cediranib, olaparib, AZD5363 (capivasertib), or durvalumab (MEDI4736)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of allergic reactions to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition to ado-trastuzumab emtansine, trastuzumab, and/or docetaxel (or any of their excipients)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known prior allergy to any of the medications used in protocol therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a known hypersensitivity to gemcitabine?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of hypersensitivity to cisplatin or platinum-containing compounds?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text_4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of allergic reactions attributed to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition to olaparib and selumetinib or any excipients thereof?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a known history of grade 3-4 allergic reaction or hypersensitivity reaction to cisplatin, carboplatin, or gemcitabine?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Chronic Disease Ind-3 (2018845v1) with VD Yes No Unknown Indicator (3506034v1) - dbw
